tags.name: abstract-action
tags.description:
Superclass for all action elements. Provides basic wiring of events to targets as well as
handle conditionals and loops of actions.

attributes.name: event
attributes.description: event to listen for

attributes.name: target
attributes.description: id of target element to attach listener to

attributes.name: ifExpr
attributes.description: boolean XPath expression. If true the action will be executed.

attributes.name: whileExpr
attributes.description:
boolean XPath expression. If true loop will be executed. If an ifExpr is present this also needs to be true
to actually run the action.

attributes.name: delay
attributes.description: delay before executing action in milliseconds

attributes.name: detail
attributes.description: detail - event detail object

attributes.name: needsUpdate
attributes.description: wether nor not an action needs to run the update cycle

attributes.name: nodeset
attributes.description: the node(s) bound by this element

attributes.name: context
attributes.description: context object for evaluation

attributes.name: model
attributes.description: the model of this element

attributes.name: modelItem
attributes.description: The modelitem object associated to the bound node holding the evaluated state.

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: XPath binding expression pointing to bound node

properties.description: event to listen for

properties.description: id of target element to attach listener to

boolean XPath expression. If true loop will be executed. If an ifExpr is present this also needs to be true
to actually run the action.

properties.description: detail - event detail object

properties.description: wether nor not an action needs to run the update cycle

properties.description: context object for evaluation

properties.name: model

properties.name: modelItem
properties.description: The modelitem object associated to the bound node holding the evaluated state.

properties.name: ref
properties.description: XPath binding expression pointing to bound node

events.name: action-performed
events.description: is dispatched after each execution of an action.

tags.name: fx-action
tags.description:
`fx-action`
an action to wrap other actions and defers the update cycle until the end of the block.

tags.name: fx-dispatch
tags.description:
`fx-dispatch`

dispatches an event with optional details.

Properties given by `fx-property` child elements are stored to the events' details object and
can be accessed in usual JavaScript way.

tags.name: fx-bind
tags.description:
FxBind declaratively attaches constraints to nodes in the data (instances).

It's major task is to create ModelItem Objects for each Node in the data their ref is pointing to.

References and constraint attributes use XPath statements to point to the nodes they are attributing.

Note: why is fx-bind not extending BoundElement? Though fx-bind has a 'ref' attr it is not bound in the sense of
getting updates about changes of the bound nodes. Instead it  acts as a factory for modelItems that are used by
BoundElements to track their state.

tags.name: fx-fore
tags.description:
Root element for forms. Kicks off initialization and displays messages.

fx-fore is the outermost container for each form. A form can have exactly one model
with arbitrary number of instances.

Main responsiblities are initialization of model, update of UI (refresh) and global messaging

tags.name: fx-repeat
tags.description:
`fx-repeat`

Repeats its template for each node in its' bound nodeset.

Template is a standard HTML `<template>` element. Once instanciated the template
is moved to the shadowDOM of the repeat for safe re-use.
